{
  "article_text": [
    "similar to an ordinary - band insulator , a topological insulator ( ti ) has a bulk energy gap in its band structure , which is generated by a strong spin - orbit interaction .",
    "the topological phase transition , brought about by the band inversion in the material , induces dirac - fermionic surface - conducting channels .",
    "@xcite this topologically protected surface state ( tss ) has a helical spin texture that is robust to small perturbations conserving the time - reversal symmetry , and thus prohibiting backscattering by nonmagnetic impurities .",
    "@xcite    diverse transport studies were conducted to characterize the tss . in general , however , as - grown tis are @xmath5- or @xmath6-doped so that the surface conduction can be predominated by bulk conduction .",
    "@xcite efforts have been made to reduce the bulk conduction by tuning the fermi level ( @xmath7 ) into the bulk band gap .",
    "@xcite even with these efforts , however , critical inconsistencies were present in the previous transport measurements .",
    "for instance , in bulk tis with a thickness larger than @xmath8 m , two - dimensional ( 2d ) shubnikov - de haas oscillations ( sdho ) were observed .",
    "nonetheless , the weak anti - localization ( wal ) effect , relevant to the tss , was often absent in the corresponding measurements , or , if present , did not fit well to the 2d hikami - larkin - nagaoka ( hln ) wal expression @xcite ( see appendix [ a ] ) . in a ti ,",
    "the wal effect is generated by a strong spin - orbit interaction and the consequent destructive interference between two electron waves traveling along a diffusive closed path in a time - reversal manner .",
    "@xcite    these inconsistencies between the 2d sdho and wal were also observed in thinner flakes , with a thickness less than @xmath8 m .",
    "@xcite furthermore , previous 2d - sdho observations @xcite may not have been fully relevant to the surface conduction by the tss . @xcite accurately identifying the berry - phase shift associated with the tss requires measurements in very strong magnetic fields , with careful landau - level indexing .",
    "@xcite in most of the previous studies , however , the @xmath9 berry - phase shift was determined based on observations in relatively weak magnetic fields .",
    "@xcite ambipolar characters with back - gating were also observed in the transport of tis , which were assumed to be associated with the tss . here",
    ", however , the wal effect was absent in the samples with relatively high carrier densities .",
    "@xcite the wal effect observed in some of these ambipolar - transport samples were reported to arise from the coupling between the surface and the bulk bands , rather than the tss exclusively .",
    "@xcite    it is an extremely difficult task to reliably separate the tss from other conductance contributions . in this study",
    ", we minimized the bulk conduction using high - quality bi@xmath0sb@xmath1te@xmath2se@xmath3 ( bsts ) ti single crystals , with @xmath7 lying in the bulk gap without gating .",
    "we confirmed that the wal effect and universal conductance fluctuations ( ucf ) indeed arose from the top and bottom surfaces . by back - gate tuning the wal characteristics , we identified the tss conducting characteristics and the coupling between the tss and the topologically trivial two - dimensional electron gas ( 2deg ) states that emerged due to band bending near the bottom surface .",
    "the ambipolar hall resistivity of the bottom surface was consistent with the back - gate - voltage ( @xmath10 ) dependence of the longitudinal resistance of the tss .",
    "this study provides a reliable means of differentiating the tss of tis from those of the bulk conducting state and the topologically trivial 2deg states , along with a highly coherent picture of the topological surface transport properties of tis .",
    "bsts single crystals were grown using the self - flux method .",
    "@xcite stoichiometric mixture of high - purity starting materials ( bi(5n ) , sb(5n ) , te(5n ) , se(5n ) ) were loaded in an evacuated quartz ampoule , which was then heated up to 850 @xmath11c .",
    "after annealing at 850 @xmath11c for 2 days to enhance the material homogeneity , the melt mixture was slowly cooled down to 600 @xmath11c for a week . before",
    "complete furnace cooling it was kept at 600 @xmath11c for one more week to further improve the crystallinity .",
    "the stoichiometry and the high crystallinity of the single crystals were confirmed by the energy dispersive spectroscopy and the x - ray diffraction , respectively .",
    "the bulk transport properties were examined using @xmath4100 @xmath12m - thick cleaved bulk crystals . for detailed characterization of transport properties with back - gating ,",
    "bsts flakes , which are 22 to 230 nm in their thickness , were mechanically exfoliated onto a si substrate capped with a 300-nm - thick oxidized layer .",
    "this was then followed by standard electron ( e)-beam patterning and e - gun evaporation of ti / au ( 10 nm/100@xmath13350 nm thick ) bilayer electrodes and contact leads . for thick crystals ,",
    "the electrode contacts were prepared using silver paste . in total , four thick bulk crystals and six thin flakes were investigated using standard lock - in measurements , varying @xmath14 from 290 to 4.2 k.",
    "dependence of the bulk crystal resistivity of the ti .",
    "inset : arrhenius - law fitting for the sample b3 .",
    "( b ) @xmath14 dependence of the normalized resistance of thin flakes .",
    "( c ) thickness dependence of the sheet conductance of thin flakes at 290 k ( triangles , red online ) and 4.2 k ( squares , blue online ) .",

    "the scale bar is 2 @xmath12 m .",
    "( f ) schematic band structure near a surface of our ti samples .",
    "the crossed lines ( red online ) represent the tss .",
    "@xmath15 represents the range of surface band bending ( or the range of carrier accumulation ) on the surface .",
    "horizontal thick lines at @xmath16 ( blue online ) represent the 2deg formed at the surface due to the surface band bending .",
    "double - parabolic curves ( blue online ) are rashba - split bands of the 2deg .",
    "horizontal dashed line corresponds to the fermi level.[thicktemp ] ]    the @xmath14 dependence of the resistivity @xmath17 of the thick bulk crystals of bsts in fig .",
    "[ thicktemp](a ) exhibits conventional semiconducting behavior down to @xmath18 k. a fit of @xmath19 to the arrhenius law renders the activation energy of @xmath20 26.1 , 21.3 , 31.6 and 20.7 mev for samples b1 , b2 , b3 and b4 ( inset in fig .",
    "[ thicktemp](a ) corresponds to sample b3 ) , consistent with previous studies .",
    "@xcite however , the resistance is saturated for @xmath14 below @xmath18 k , which indicates the emergence of additional conducting channels .",
    "this behavior was more pronounced in the thin flakes .",
    "figure  [ thicktemp](b ) shows a clear semiconductor - metal transition as the thickness of the flakes decreases .",
    "the variation of @xmath19 with the flake thickness can be interpreted in terms of surface - conducting channels in the presence of a bulk insulating gap , as illustrated in fig .",
    "[ thicktemp](f ) . with @xmath7 inside the bulk energy gap , the residual bulk conduction by carriers thermally activated from an impurity band was dominant in the thick crystals ( fig .",
    "[ thicktemp](a ) ) .",
    "thin flakes , however , with less bulk conductance , exhibited metallic behavior .",
    "one can confirm this behavior by modelling the simple form for total sheet conductance as follows : @xmath21 where @xmath22 is the surface sheet conductance , @xmath23 is the bulk conductivity , and @xmath24 is the thickness of crystals . here , @xmath22 includes the conduction through the 2deg layer ( see fig .     "inset : @xmath14 dependence of the root - mean - square of @xmath44 extracted from the data in ( e).[angletemp ] ]    the surface - dominant conduction at low @xmath14 becomes more evident in the field - angle dependence of the magnetoresistance ( mr ) .",
    "figure [ angletemp](b ) shows that all of the mr curves taken at different field angles ( fig .",
    "[ angletemp](a ) ) , plotted as a function of the normal component of the field ( b@xmath46 ) , merge into a single universal curve ( see appendix [ c ] for the discussion on the mr feature in in - plane fields ; @xmath47=90@xmath11 ) .",
    "even the positions of the ucf peaks agree with each other when plotted as a function of b@xmath46 ( fig .",
    "[ angletemp](c ) ) .",
    "these features strongly indicate that the mr in our sample was almost completely dominated by surface conduction over the entire field range of our measurements .",
    "previously , the cos(@xmath47 ) angle dependence of the mr was observed only in the low - field range of @xmath48 within a fraction of tesla .",
    "@xcite    the 2d nature was identified more quantitatively from the @xmath14 dependence of the mr .",
    "figure [ angletemp](d ) is the @xmath14 dependence of wal effects and the best fits of @xmath49 to eq .",
    "( [ hlnequation ] ) , from which we obtained the @xmath14 dependence of the phase relaxation length @xmath45 as shown in fig .",
    "[ angletemp](f ) ( more details of the wal effect are discussed below ) .",
    "figure [ angletemp](e ) shows the @xmath14 dependence of @xmath50 , with the corresponding @xmath14 dependence of the ucf amplitude @xmath51 shown in the inset of fig .",
    "[ angletemp](f ) . in a 2d system with a sample dimension of @xmath52",
    ", @xmath45 scales as @xmath53 for inelastic scattering by electron - electron interaction , and @xmath51 is proportional to @xmath45 .",
    "@xcite in fig .",
    "[ angletemp](f ) , both @xmath45 and @xmath51 scale as @xmath53 , in good agreement with the theoretical predictions , indicating that the dominant inelastic scattering in the surface - conducting channels of our bsts flakes was due to the electron - electron interaction .",
    "up to this point , results from our bsts consistently indicate that the bulk conduction was negligible , and that both wal and ucf had a 2d nature .",
    "the wal in the tss arose from the berry phase @xmath54 caused by the helical spin texture . since the rashba - split 2deg has the momentum - locked spin helicity ( see figs .",
    "[ gatewal](d ) , ( e ) , and ( f ) ) , the topologically trivial 2deg states also exhibit the wal effect . applying @xmath10",
    ", we confirmed that the wal effect arose from surface conduction , in both tss and the topologically trivial 2deg , with negligible bulk conduction . according to the hln theory , for a 2d system in the symplectic limit , _",
    "i.e. _ , in the limit of strong spin - orbit coupling ( @xmath55 ; @xmath56 is the dephasing time , @xmath57 the spin - orbit scattering time , and @xmath58 the elastic scattering time ) with a negligible zeeman term , the magnetoconductance correction is given as follows : @xmath59,\\ ] ] where @xmath60 is the digamma function , @xmath61 is the electronic charge , @xmath62 is planck s constant divided by @xmath63 , and @xmath45 is the phase - relaxation length .",
    "@xcite because the wal effect constitutes a prominent transport property of the tss , the relationship between the parameter @xmath64 and the number of conducting channels in the symplectic limit is essential to differentiating the transport nature of tis .",
    "@xcite each 2d conducting channel in the symplectic limit contributes 0.5 to the value of @xmath64 .",
    "if there are two independent 2d conducting channels in the symplectic limit , @xmath65 ( @xmath66 , corresponding to the channel @xmath67 ) and @xmath45 is replaced by the effective phase relaxation length ( see appendix [ d ] for details of the wal fitting ) .",
    "we confirmed that the back - gating affected only the bottom - surface conductance for the 85@xmath490 nm - thick samples ( f3 and f4 ) ( see appendix [ e ] ) .",
    "figure [ gatewal](a ) shows @xmath68 vs @xmath48 in color codes ( online ) as a function @xmath10 . here",
    ", the wal effect occurs over the entire range of @xmath10 of this study with a maximum @xmath68 at @xmath69 v , the dirac point of the tss at the bottom surface ( corresponding to the center diagram in region ii of fig .",
    "[ gatewal](c ) ) .",
    "figure [ gatewal](b ) shows @xmath68 curves for different values of @xmath10 , which agree well with eq .",
    "( [ hlnequation ] ) ( solid curves ) over the entire range of @xmath48 ; the corresponding values of @xmath64 are plotted in fig .",
    "[ gatewal](g ) . for all @xmath10",
    ", @xmath64 exceeds unity , indicating that more than two 2d conducting channels with the symplectic - limit behavior were involved in the surface conduction .",
    "in region ii of fig .",
    "[ gatewal](g ) , the tss in the bottom surface contributes a value of 0.5 to @xmath64 .",
    "this leaves @xmath70 for the top surface , which does not appear to be affected by @xmath10 .",
    "thus , we infer that the band bending near the top surface is like what is shown in fig .",
    "[ gatewal](c ) . in the top surface , in addition to the tss",
    ", the two rashba - split channels in the trivial 2deg layer also exhibit wal in the symplectic limit .",
    "@xcite however , the magnitude of @xmath64 is reduced from 1.5 ( = 0.5@xmath713 ) to @xmath41 due to inter - band scattering , where the degree of reduction depends on the scattering strength .",
    "@xcite in region i , @xmath7 also enters the bulk conduction band ( bcb ) of the bottom surface .",
    "but , if the surface band bending is not enough to make a sufficient rashba splitting in the 2deg states as in fig .",
    "[ gatewal](f ) , the band structure of the 2deg would be similar to the unitary case , @xcite where the scattering between the tss and the topologically trivial 2deg states is enhanced along with weakening of the wal effect .",
    "@xcite this reduces the value of @xmath64 of the bottom surface down to @xmath72 , while leaving @xmath64 unchanged at @xmath73 for the top surface . if @xmath74 is shifted deeper into the conduction band as to form a 2deg on the bottom surface with a large - rashba - split bulk subband ( fig .  [ gatewal](d ) ) , the wal effect will be enhanced again , with the value of @xmath64 larger than 0.5 as shown in fig .",
    "[ gatewal](c ) for the top surface . @xcite in region iii , a similar reduction of @xmath64 is expected for the bottom surface , due to the enhanced scattering between the tss and the bulk valence band ( bvb ) .",
    "thus , the variation of @xmath64 with @xmath10 in fig .  [ gatewal](g ) is the result of variation of the wal in the bottom surface state .",
    "the wal effects reported previously on tis with @xmath75 @xcite or @xmath76 @xcite contained a finite bulk contribution .",
    "@xmath75 corresponded to an effective single layer formed by the bulk and the two ( top and bottom ) surfaces , which are strongly coupled together .",
    "meanwhile , @xmath76 corresponded to an effective single layer formed by the @xmath5-type bulk strongly coupled to the top surface , in association with the @xmath6-type bottom surface that was decoupled from the bulk by the formation of the depletion layer for a large negative value of @xmath10 .",
    "@xcite to the best of our knowledge ,",
    "no previous reports have shown good fits to the symplectic - limit expression of eq .",
    "( [ hlnequation ] ) for fields up to several tesla , with @xmath64 exceeding unity .",
    "@xcite although the good fits of our results to eq .",
    "( [ hlnequation ] ) without the zeeman correction may be related to the recent report of small land @xmath77 factor in tis , @xcite more studies are required to draw a definite conclusion on the issue .",

    "( [ twobandmodel]).[hall ] ]    from the thickness , field - angle , and temperature dependence of the resistance , we conclude that in our bsts samples the electronic transport was dominated by the top and bottom surfaces . in this case , the hall resistivity can be described by a standard two - band model as @xcite @xmath87 here , @xmath88 and @xmath89 are the density and mobility of the carriers , respectively , in the @xmath67-th conducting channel .",
    "the top ( @xmath67=1 ) and bottom ( @xmath67=2 ) surfaces constitute parallel conducting channels , with @xmath88 being positive ( negative ) for @xmath5-type ( @xmath6-type ) carriers .",

    "[ gatewal](c ) ) , with @xmath7 in the bvb , scattering between the tss and the bvb was enhanced once again .",
    "@xcite the resulting suppression of @xmath104 , combined with an increase of @xmath118 in the range of @xmath117 v along with the relationship @xmath119 for the bottom surface , may explain the low sensitivity of @xmath120 to @xmath10 in fig .",
    "[ gatewal](g ) .    fitting the @xmath80 data to eq .",
    "( [ twobandmodel ] ) gives more quantitative support for the analysis above on the @xmath10 dependence of the hall resistivity .",
    "the inset of fig .",
    "[ hall](b ) shows the representative hall resistivity for @xmath84 30 , @xmath85 , and @xmath86 v , where the solid curves are the best fits to eq .",
    "( [ twobandmodel ] ) with the parameter values summarized in figs .",
    "[ hall](b ) and ( c ) .",
    "@xmath121 in fig .",
    "[ hall](b ) is almost constant for all values of @xmath10 , while @xmath118 changes its sign between @xmath5 and @xmath6 types at @xmath69 v. this indicates ambipolar transport for the bottom surface with varying @xmath10 across the dirac point , while the top surface remained mostly unaffected by back - gating , consistent with earlier qualitative analysis of @xmath10 dependent hall resistivity .",
    "this back - gating effect on the two surfaces was also confirmed by the mobility change . in fig .",
    "[ hall](c ) , the best - fit values of @xmath103 are almost insensitive to the variation of @xmath10 .",
    "however , @xmath104 turns out to be significantly larger than @xmath103 in the region , @xmath1350 v@xmath1220 v , where @xmath7 is assumed to be in the dirac band of the bottom surface .",
    "the @xmath104 enhancement possibly stems from the mobility increase as @xmath7 shifts into the dirac band of the bottom surface from the trivial 2deg band ( either conduction or valence ) , where @xmath104 is reduced by the scattering between the tss and the trivial 2deg band .",
    "it should be noted that , with the invasive configuration of electrodes adopted in this study , the observed hall voltage is bound to be underestimated .",
    "however , the qualitative @xmath10 dependence of the parameters in eq .",
    "( [ twobandmodel ] ) remains valid .",
    "the @xmath9 berry - phase shift in sdho is often adopted to examine the topological nature of surface transport . however ,",
    "very strong magnetic fields of @xmath123 50 t with careful landau - level indexing , required for accurate determination of the berry phase , have made it difficult to clearly differentiate the conductance by the tss from that by the trivial 2d - conducting states .",
    "observation of sdho also requires relatively high mobility with a sufficiently long mean - free path to support the cyclotron orbital motion .",
    "in contrast , the observation of wal , an intrinsic 2d effect , directly points to conduction by the tss . furthermore , wal , which arises from the coherent diffusive motion of carriers , is not limited to the high mobility state . in this sense , the wal effect which was used primarily in this study can be considered to be a more essential criterion than the sdho for confirming the conduction by the tss .    for flakes",
    "significantly thicker than an optimum thickness of @xmath480@xmath1390 nm , the bulk conductance can not be neglected . on the other hand , as the range of band bending near the top and bottom surfaces begins to overlap for thinner flakes , independent gate control of the surface conduction would no longer be possible .",
    "thus , our approach of separating the tss by examining the transport characteristics specific to the 2d - topological nature in the optimal - thickness crystal flakes ( in combination with back - gating ) provides a convenient means of investigating the fundamental topological nature of the surface conduction and the quantum - device applications associated with momentum - locked spin polarization in the surface state of tis .",
    "hjl thanks v. sacksteder for valuable discussion on the in - plane mr .",
    "this work was supported by the national research foundation ( nrf ) , through the src center for topological matter [ grant no .",
    "2011 - 0030788 ( for hjl ) and 2011 - 0030785 ( for jsk ) ] , the gfr center for advanced soft electronics ( grant no . 2011 - 0031640 ; for hjl ) , and the mid - career researcher program ( grant no . 2012 - 013838 ; for jsk ) .",
    "the weak anti - localization ( wal ) in bulk topological insulator ( ti ) single crystals and thin ti flakes with high carrier density was reported previously .",
    "@xcite however , the magnitude of the consequent conductance correction ( @xmath124 ) was larger than our results by one or two orders of magnitude . since the magnitude of @xmath124 is proportional to the parameter @xmath64 in eq .",
    "( [ hlnequation ] ) in the main text , which corresponds to the number of parallel conducting channels , one may suspect that multiple two - dimensional ( 2d ) conducting channels connected in parallel were present for the conduction of ti in previous studies .",
    "a recent report @xcite supports the inference . in ref .",
    "[ ] , it was concluded that the observed quantized hall effect and sdho were not caused by the topologically protected surface state ( tss ) but by many topologically trivial 2d conducting channels connected in parallel .    from the sdho measurements ,",
    "one can obtain the information on the dimensionality and carrier density of the conducting channels . in the sdho analysis",
    ", the degeneracy 2   corresponds to the bulk band or the topologically trivial two - dimensional electron gas ( 2deg ) on the surface accumulation layer , while the degeneracy 1   corresponds to the tss . in some previous studies , @xcite",
    "the carrier density was estimated from the sdho data adopting the degeneracy 1   under the assumption that the observed sdho arose from the tss . the carrier density estimated in this way",
    "was claimed to be relevant to the tss , based on the fact that , with @xmath7 lying in the tss , the maximum carrier density is expected to be @xmath125 @xmath126 depending on the ti materials used .",
    "however , if the sdho had arisen from the topologically trivial 2d conducting channels , the degeneracy should have been 2   with a doubled carrier density . in this case , however , a dirac cone can not accommodate all the carrier states estimated with the degeneracy 2   in ref .",
    "[ ] and [ ] without the bulk conduction band or 2deg states .    in fact , the sdho frequencies themselves obtained in ref.and refs .",
    "[ , ] were not much different from each other .",
    "thus , the difference in the carrier densities between ref .",
    "[ ] and refs.resulted from the different degeneracy values adopted in the analysis . depending on the degeneracy value used in the sdho analysis , one may reach very different conclusions on the topological nature of the conducting channels involved in the sdho data . in this sense ,",
    "observation of the sdho itself can not confirm the existence of the tss .",
    "correctly identifying the berry phase in strong magnetic fields is essential to confirming the tss in tis .",
    "the surface band bending effect is a common feature of semiconductors . in particular , for narrow - gap semiconductors , the transport and electronic contact properties are strongly affected by the surface band bending .",
    "the materials which are identified as tis are , in general , narrow - gap semiconductors whose band gap is about @xmath127 .",
    "@xcite since the energy levels of the surface state can be shifted up to a few hundred mev , @xcite the surface band bending has a large influence on transport properties of tis .",
    "but , it has not been studied in depth to date .    the depth of the surface accumulation layer ( @xmath15 in fig .",
    "[ thicktemp](f ) in main text ) depends on the distribution of the local carrier density along the @xmath128-axis .",
    "@xcite for samples with the relatively high carrier density , _",
    "i.e. _ , if @xmath7 lies in the bulk conduction band , @xmath15 was calculated to be @xmath129 nm .",
    "@xcite @xmath15 can increase further as the carrier density decreases .",
    "@xcite since , in our sample , @xmath7 lies in the bulk band gap with a low bulk carrier density , @xmath15 can be longer than @xmath130 nm .",
    "in addition , in comparison with the bottom surface , the top surface is more exposed to chemicals and e - beam irradiation through the sample preparation processes . from the careful analysis provided in the main text",
    ", we concluded that these processes caused the band bending at the top surface , which was larger than that at the bottom surface , as illustrated in fig .",
    "[ gatewal](c ) in the main text .",
    "( color online ) ( a ) the mr at @xmath36 v for different angles @xmath131 ( black online ) and @xmath132 ( blue online ) of sample f4 .",
    "( b ) an expanded view of the mr at @xmath133.[inplanemr ] ]    figure [ inplanemr ] shows the mr at @xmath134 ; direction of magnetic field is in parallel with the top and bottom surfaces of the sample and perpendicular to the current direction ( see fig .",
    "[ angletemp](a ) in main text ) . if the conduction in our thin flakes was only through the two surfaces ( top and bottom ) and only the localization effect affected the mr , the mr should have vanished at @xmath134 . as shown in fig .",
    "[ inplanemr ] , however , a small but finite mr exists at @xmath134 .",
    "the simplest inference is that the mr at @xmath134 is a bulk component . in ref .",
    "[ ] , the mr proportional to @xmath135 at @xmath134 was observed . in the data analysis ,",
    "this component was subtracted from the mr obtained in other field angles . since the samples used in ref .",
    "[ ] had a large carrier density , the large weight of the bulk conductance was reasonable with the @xmath135 classical behavior of the mr supporting that analysis .    however , in our samples , as shown in fig .",
    "[ inplanemr ] , we did not find a valid argument to consider the mr at @xmath132 as the three - dimensional ( 3d ) bulk contribution .",
    "the @xmath135-type classical mr was absent at @xmath132 .",
    "instead , the mr behavior was reminiscent of the wal effect .",
    "but , there is no consensus yet on whether the magnetoconductance ( mc ) correction ( @xmath124 ) of bulk carriers in tis should follow the wal or the weak localization ( wl ) behavior .",
    "@xcite thus , it is not clear whether the wal - like @xmath136 in our data is of bulk origin .",
    "if the mr at @xmath134 corresponds to the 3d bulk contribution , in order to extract @xmath124 of the surface conducting channels , one has to use @xmath137 rather than @xmath138 as used in the main text .",
    "but the bulk origin of @xmath139 is not clear . on the other hand ,",
    "the magnitude of @xmath124 at @xmath140 is sufficiently smaller than that at @xmath141 so that the discussion on the angle dependence of mr and the @xmath10 dependence of mr at @xmath141 in the main text is not affected even without subtracting @xmath142 .",
    "therefore , we used the raw data for analysis of the gate dependence of wal effects in fig .",
    "[ gatewal ] in main text .",
    "it is not clear what caused this finite mr at @xmath134 in our ti flakes .",
    "it may have arisen from the side - wall surfaces of the thin crystal or even the in - plane mr of the surface conducting channels .",
    "there are some theoretical prediction of in - plane field - dependence mc correction for a 2d system , but not in the symplectic case .",
    "@xcite to the best of our knowledge , however , in - plane field - dependence mc correction of 2d systems in the symplectic limit has not been studied yet .",
    "( color online ) sets of graphs of ( i ) the digamma function @xmath143 , ( ii ) the hln function @xmath144 $ ] , and ( iii ) the logarithmic function @xmath145 of eq .",
    "( s1 ) for @xmath146 , with @xmath147 and @xmath148 @xmath149 @xmath150.[hlnfunction1 ] ]    magnetoconductance ( mc ) correction of a 2d system in a symplectic limit can be expressed as eq .",
    "( [ hlnequation ] ) in the main text ( hln function ) .",
    "if there are two independent 2d conducting channels , the equation is expanded as follows : @xmath151,\\ ] ] where @xmath60 is the digamma function , @xmath61 is the electron charge , @xmath66 corresponds to the channel @xmath67 with the phase relaxation length @xmath152 . @xcite if @xmath153 , eq . ( [ twohln ] ) is simplified as follows : @xmath154.\\ ] ] however , if @xmath155 , the number of fitting parameters increases up to 4 with a larger standard error .",
    "we solved this problem by taking the following simple approximation .    in fig .",
    "[ hlnfunction1 ] , the set of curves ( i ) represents the digamma function part , the set ( iii ) corresponds to the logarithmic function part , and the set ( ii ) corresponds to the sum of the two parts .",
    "each function is plotted with @xmath147 and @xmath148 @xmath156 @xmath150 . as displayed in fig .",
    "[ hlnfunction1 ] , the digamma - function part is almost constant except in the weak - field region for different values of @xmath45 .",
    "thus , the hln expression is mostly determined by the logarithmic part .",
    "the digamma function causes a constant shift of the logarithmic function and removes the logarithmic divergence in zero field .",
    "based on this fact , four parameters in eq .",
    "( [ twohln ] ) can be reduced to two parameters as follows .",
    "let s define @xmath152 is the phase relaxation length of channel @xmath67 ( @xmath157 ) with the corresponding coefficient @xmath66 and @xmath158 is the effective phase relaxation length with @xmath159 .",
    "applying the approximated behavior of the digamma function leads to    @xmath160\\\\\\nonumber & + \\alpha_2\\frac{e^2}{2\\pi^2\\hbar}\\left[\\ln\\left(\\frac{\\hbar}{4el^2_{\\phi,2 } b}\\right)-\\psi\\left(\\frac{1}{2}+\\frac{\\hbar}{4el^2_{\\phi,2 } b}\\right)\\right]\\\\\\nonumber \\approx ~ & \\alpha_1\\frac{e^2}{2\\pi^2\\hbar}\\left[\\ln\\left(\\frac{\\hbar}{4el^2_{\\phi,1 } b}\\right)-\\psi\\left(\\frac{1}{2}+\\frac{\\hbar}{4e(l^{\\textrm{eff}}_\\phi)^2b}\\right)\\right]\\\\\\nonumber & + \\alpha_2\\frac{e^2}{2\\pi^2\\hbar}\\left[\\ln\\left(\\frac{\\hbar}{4el^2_{\\phi,2 } b}\\right)-\\psi\\left(\\frac{1}{2}+\\frac{\\hbar}{4e(l^{\\textrm{eff}}_\\phi)^2b}\\right)\\right]\\\\\\nonumber = ~&-\\left(\\alpha_1+\\alpha_2\\right)\\frac{e^2}{2\\pi^2\\hbar}\\psi\\left(\\frac{1}{2}+\\frac{\\hbar}{4e(l^{\\textrm{eff}}_\\phi)^2b}\\right)\\\\\\label{approx } & + \\frac{e^2}{2\\pi^2\\hbar}\\left[\\alpha_1\\ln\\left(\\frac{\\hbar}{4el^2_{\\phi,1 } b}\\right)+\\alpha_2\\ln\\left(\\frac{\\hbar}{4el^2_{\\phi,2 } b}\\right)\\right].\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    the logarithmic part in eq .",
    "( [ approx ] ) becomes @xmath161\\\\\\label{eff } = & \\left(\\alpha_1+\\alpha_2\\right)\\ln\\left(\\frac{\\hbar}{4e(l^{\\textrm{eff}}_\\phi)^2b}\\right)\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where @xmath162 .",
    "therefore , with eq .",
    "( [ approx ] ) , the eq .",
    "( [ twohln ] ) can be simplified as @xmath163\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] with @xmath164 .",
    "figure [ hlnfunction2 ] shows the validity of this approximation .",
    "( color online ) three curves ( blue , black and red online ) correspond to graphs of eqs .",
    "( d6 ) , ( d7 ) , and ( d8 ) for @xmath165 , @xmath166 , @xmath167 and @xmath168 .",
    "inset shows the expanded view in the low - field range.[hlnfunction2 ] ]    in fig .",
    "[ hlnfunction2 ] , the three curves ( blue , black and red online ) correspond to the followings @xmath169&+\\alpha_2[\\ln(l_{\\phi,2})-\\psi(l_{\\phi,2})]\\\\ \\alpha_1[\\ln(l_{\\phi,1})-\\psi(l_{\\phi,1})]&+\\alpha_2[\\ln(l_{\\phi,2})-\\psi(l_{\\phi,2})]\\\\ \\alpha_1[\\ln(l_{\\phi,1})-\\psi(l_{\\phi,1})]&+\\alpha_2[\\ln(l_{\\phi,2})-\\psi(l_{\\phi,1})],\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] respectively . here , @xmath170 and @xmath171 . as displayed in fig .",
    "[ hlnfunction2 ] , the deviation caused by different @xmath45 in digamma function can be recognized only in low fields .",
    "furthermore , since @xmath158 has a value between @xmath172 and @xmath173 , the deviation may be smaller than differences displayed in fig .",
    "[ hlnfunction2 ] .",
    "therefore , even with 4 parameters in different two channels , we can apply the one - channel hln function with two parameters and the determined @xmath64 and @xmath45 can be understood as @xmath174 and @xmath175 as eq .",
    "( [ walfunction ] ) .",
    "( color online ) @xmath10 and @xmath176 dependencies of the resistance for the 87 nm - thick bsts flake . between two adjacent curves @xmath10 is varied by 5 v.[top ] ]    figure [ top ] shows the resistance variation of an 87-nm - thick bsts flake ( thickness of this flake is almost identical to that of the samples f3 and f4 ) as functions of back - gate ( @xmath10 ) and top - gate ( @xmath176 ) voltages .",
    "this sample is not referred to in the main text . except for the parallel shift in the resistance , the @xmath176 dependence of the resistance curves in fig .",
    "[ top ] remains unaltered with varying @xmath10 .",
    "even the positions of the resistance spikes arising from the ucf effect do not change for different values of @xmath10 .",
    "this feature indicates that the top - surface ( bottom - surface ) conductance is almost completely independent of @xmath10 ( @xmath176 ) .",
    "since this flake and the samples f3 and f4 are of almost identical thickness we expect that the top - surface conductance of the two samples was independent of @xmath10 , the fact of which is utilized in our analysis in the main text .",
    "65ifxundefined [ 1 ] ifx#1 ifnum [ 1 ] # 1firstoftwo secondoftwo ifx [ 1 ] # 1firstoftwo secondoftwo `` `` # 1''''@noop [ 0]secondoftwosanitize@url [ 0 ]  + 12$12  & * * ,   ( ) ] link:\\doibase    10.1103/physrevb.82.081305 [ * * ,   ( ) ] @noop _ _ ( ,  ) link:\\doibase 10.1103/physrevlett.107.056803 [ * * ,   ( ) ] link:\\doibase    10.1021/nn204239d [ * * ,   ( ) ] link:\\doibase    10.1073/pnas.1115555109 [ * * ,   ( ) ] link:\\doibase 10.1103/revmodphys.54.437 [ * * ,   ( ) ] link:\\doibase 10.1103/physrevlett.34.15 [ * * , ( ) ] link:\\doibase 10.1143/jpsj.50.2516 [ * * , ( ) ] http://www.jetpletters.ac.ru/ps/1510/article_23070.shtml [ * * ,   ( ) ]"
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> using field - angle , temperature , and back - gate - voltage dependence of the weak anti - localization ( wal ) and universal conductance fluctuations of thin bi@xmath0sb@xmath1te@xmath2se@xmath3 topological - insulator single crystals , in combination with gate - tuned hall resistivity measurements , we reliably separated the surface conduction of the topological nature from both the bulk conduction and topologically trivial surface conduction . </S>",
    "<S> we minimized the bulk conduction in the crystals and back - gate tuned the fermi level to the topological bottom - surface band while keeping the top surface insensitive to back - gating with the optimal crystal thickness of @xmath4100 nm . we argue that the wal effect occurring by the coherent diffusive motion of carriers in relatively low magnetic fields is more essential than other transport tools such as the shubnikov - de hass oscillations for confirming the conduction by the topologically protected surface state . </S>",
    "<S> our approach provides a highly coherent picture of the surface transport properties of tis and a reliable means of investigating the fundamental topological nature of surface conduction and possible quantum - device applications related to momentum - locked spin polarization in surface states . </S>"
  ]
}
